channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13222] Provide means of non-destructive balancer inspection
item.description: At least on 0.98 (haven't checked master, 1.0), it seems we don't have a means for accessing balancer status w.o changing it in the process. Here's a little script to tickle ZK and see what the flag is. Would be nice if this was available from the shell, on the master status page, or something similar.
item.summary: Provide means of non-destructive balancer inspection

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch for 0.98

Patch lgtm, but shouldn't we have this everywhere. Do later versions provide an API? Interested in adding one? The shell code could try using the API and fall back to znode inspection if it's not available.
Don't you love that balanceSwitch() is acting according to Heisenberg principle. You cannot observe without modifying the state.
Gonna try to expand on this – add a nice API that we can hopefully use in the shell (without some/much custom ruby code) and the web interfaces.

Thoughts/opinions on whether inquiry into the balancer's state should extend beyond a simple on/off? I'm trying to think of whether a new RPC should be a simple "IsBalancerEnabled" or a more flexible "BalancerState" would be better in the long run.

It's hard to judge what common information across a general interface (LoadBalancer) might want to return. Not sure if it's worth to make a more general response msg.
Maybe the more generic API would support retrieving status of multiple Master management tasks. HBASE-13103 would be adding another such task to the master's repertoire.

Something like MasterChores, and then we can define sub-messages within such as Balancer, table reshape and other chores?

Looking at the existing Master protos, we have IsCatalogJanitorEnabled already. Maybe we could consider a single RPC that combines related stuff into one call long term? If at least one old call is there already, there will be some lifetime attached to them. I'll have to see how this looks – would probably give a better feeling for how it'd operate.

Introduces Admin#isBalancerEnabled implemented through a new HMaster RPC.

Thoughts?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12707115/HBASE-13222.patch
against master branch at commit 227ace9100043613a014d897dc78e97cc214ffac.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12707115

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 4 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ * <code>rpc IsBalancerEnabled(.IsBalancerEnabledRequest) returns (.IsBalancerEnabledResponse);</code>
+ * <code>rpc IsBalancerEnabled(.IsBalancerEnabledRequest) returns (.IsBalancerEnabledResponse);</code>

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

Looks good. For shell, we have catalogjanitor_enabled, maybe we can do balancer_enabled instead of balancer_state.
WFM!
Changes shell command to balancer_enabled. Also removes the extra "Enabled:" prefix from the command output to match the other shell commands.

Thanks Josh for the patch. I've committed this to master and branch-1. Andrew Purtell I've dropped 0.98 from the fixVersions since the patch ended up being much more intrusive than Nicks initial patch.
